snippet: Both men were Egyptian immigrants of a similar age who were shot with .22-caliber guns in their own stores.
abstract: Recent shooting deaths of Brooklyn shopkeepers Isaac Kadare and Mohamed Gebeli are eerily similar, despite occurring four weeks apart; both were shot in the head or neck with what police say were .22 caliber guns; both men were older Egyptian immigrants and had shop addresses that contained the numbers 7, 1 and 8; a sketch of the suspect has been released, but no arrests have been made.

byline.original: By CARA BUCKLEY and ERIC P. NEWCOMER

lead_paragraph: Both men were Egyptian immigrants of a similar age who were shot with .22-caliber guns in their own stores.

headline.seo: Killings of 2 Brooklyn Shopkeepers Unnerve Fellow Merchants
headline.main: Fatal Shootings of 2 Brooklyn Shopkeepers Unnerve Fellow Merchants
headline.print_headline: Fatal Shootings of 2 Brooklyn Shopkeepers Unnerve Fellow Merchants
